alert.note: Alert for Estill; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 6:14AM EDT until August 06 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Estill, Menifee, Montgomery and Powell. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stanton, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Waltersville, Bean, Powell Valley, Virden, Rosslyn, Westbend, Cat Creek, Levee, Lucky Stop, Spout Springs, Means, Cedar Groves, Clay Lick, Kimbrell, Cressy and Iron Mound.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
